translation.pcm: Bazoum tok di effort of Niger Rebuplic under am as di presido go focus on top Mali.

translation.en: The current situation in Mali has a direct impact on domestic security in our country, he said.
translation.pcm: He tok say di current situation for inside Mali get direct impact on top security for dem own country.

translation.en: IS-linked insurgents are based in Menaka and Gao, in eastern and central Mali respectively, said Bazoum.
translation.pcm: Insurgents wey dem don link to IS get dem base for Menaka and Gao, for eastern and central Mali as Bazoum don tok am.

translation.en: Combatting them will be very difficult so long as the Malian state does not exercise full sovereignty over these regions, he said.
translation.pcm: He tok say to fight dem go dey very difficult as long say Mali as a kontri no get full charge ova di region dem.

translation.en: In the early hours of Wednesday, after gunfire broke out near the presidency in the capital Niamey, the government announced an attempted coup had been thwarted.
translation.pcm: For early hours inside Wednesday, afta dem begin shoot gun near presidency for Niamey, di goment tok say dem don stop di coup wey dem wan do.

translation.en: It described this as a cowardly and regressive act which sought to threaten democracy and the state of law.
translation.pcm: E describe di thing as act of of a coward and regressive wey be treath to democracy and state of di law.

translation.en: The West African nation has suffered four coups in its history, most recently a February 2010 putsch that toppled then-president Mamadou Tandja.
translation.pcm: Na four coup di kontri wey dey for West Africa don suffer, di one wey recent pass apun for Februry 2010, and im komot Presido Mamadou Tandja.

translation.en: Google threatens to withdraw from Australia
translation.pcm: Google tok say dem fit komot from Australia

translation.en: Google has threatened to remove its search engine from Australia over the nation's attempt to make the tech giant share royalties with news publishers.
translation.pcm: Google don carry threat give Australia say dem go komot di search engine for inside di kontri, as di kontri don tell dem to dey share gain with pipo wey dey publish news.

translation.en: Australia is introducing a world-first law to make Google, Facebook and potentially other tech companies pay media outlets for their news content.
translation.pcm: Australia wan introduce di kind law wey be di first of im kind as dem wan make Google, Facebook, and oda tech companies dem to dey pay news pipo for di content wey dem dey bring.

translation.en: But the US firms have fought back, warning the law would make them withdraw some of their services.
translation.pcm: But di firm wey dey for inside US don fight back, dem warn say dem fit komot dem service inside di kontri.

translation.en: Australian PM Scott Morrison said lawmakers would not yield to threats.
translation.pcm: Oga Prime Minister for inside Australia, dat na Scott Morrison tok say lamakers no go listen to any threat.

translation.en: Though Australia is far from Google's largest market, the proposed news code is seen as a possible global test case for how governments could seek to regulate big tech firms.
translation.pcm: Although Australia no be one of di big places wey Google dey take market dem things, dis news code wey dem dey propose fit be global test of how goment go begin regulate big tech firms dem.

translation.en: Australia's code would tie Google and Facebook to mediated negotiations with publishers over the value of news content, if no agreement could be reached first.
translation.pcm: Dis code for Australia go tie Google and Facebook, to negotiate wit publishers over di worth of dem news content if dem no fit reach agreement for di beginin.

translation.en: Google Australia managing director Mel Silva told a Senate hearing on Friday that the laws were unworkable.
translation.pcm: Di managing Director of Google for insde Australia, Mel Silva tell one senate siddon tok on Friday say di law no go work.

translation.en: If this version of the code were to become law, it would give us no real choice but to stop making Google Search available in Australia, she said.
translation.pcm: She tok say if dem pass dis kind version of di code to bikom law, Google no go get choice pass say make dem pack komot for inside Australia.

translation.en: But lawmakers challenged this, accusing Google of blackmail and bullying Australia for raising the reform.
translation.pcm: But lawmakers dem attack am, dem tok say na blackmail and bully Google wan do for Australia seek of say dem raise di reform.

translation.en: s going to go worldwide.
translation.pcm: E go rech evriwia for di world

translation.en: Are you going to pull out of every market, are you?
translation.pcm: Shet una go komt for evri market, una go komot?

translation.en: Is this about stopping the precedence? asked Senator Rex Patrick.
translation.pcm: Senator Rex Patrick ask say shey dem wan stop di precedence ni?

translation.en: Silva replied that the code was an untenable risk for our Australian operations.
translation.pcm: Silva reply dem say di code na risk wey no dey tenable for dem operation for inside Australia.

translation.en: Morrison said his government remained committed to progressing the laws through parliament this year.
translation.pcm: Morrison tok say im goment dey committed make di law for get progress through parliament dis year.

translation.en: Let me be clear: Australia makes our rules for things you can do in Australia.
translation.pcm: Make I tok am clear: Na Australia dey make rule of wetin you fit do for inside Australia.

translation.en: That's done in our parliament, he told reporters on Friday.
translation.pcm: Na for awa parliament we dey do dat one, as im take tell news people on Friday.

translation.en: Why is Australia pushing this law?
translation.pcm: Why Australia dey push for dis kind law?

translation.en: Google is the dominant search engine in Australia and has been described by the government as a near-essential utility with little market competition.
translation.pcm: Google na di dominant search engine for inside Australia, and di government don describe as essential utility wey no really get any market competition.

translation.en: The government has argued that because the tech platforms gain customers from people who want to read the news, the tech giants should pay newsrooms a fair amount for their journalism.
translation.pcm: Di goment argument be say bkos di tech giant det get customer among pipo wey wan read news, make dem dey pay amount wey dey good to newsroom for dem journalism.

translation.en: In addition, it has argued that the financial support is needed for its embattled news industry because a strong media is vital to democracy.
translation.pcm: In addition, dem argue say di financial support dey necessary or dem embattled news industry bkos strong media dey vital to democracy.

translation.en: Australian print media has seen a 75% decline in advertising revenue since 2005, according to the government.
translation.pcm: Accordi to wetin Government tok, print media for inside Australia don suffer 75% reduction for money since 2005.

translation.en: Google's threat to remove its entire search product is its most severe yet.
translation.pcm: Na di thret wey Google tok say dem go remove dem entire seach engine na im tough pass.

translation.en: News accounts for just 12.5% of Google searches in Australia, according to lawmakers.
translation.pcm: Di lawmakers tok say news dey only account for 12.5% of di search wey pipo dey take Google do for inside Australia.

translation.en: Poultry farmers beg for importation of animal grade maize, soya meals
translation.pcm: Poultry farmers don dey beg say make dem begin import animal grade maize and soya meal dem.

translation.en: Dr Olalekan Odunsi, the South-West general-secretary, Poultry Association of Nigeria (PAN), has called on government to facilitate the importation of animal grade maize and soya meals.
translation.pcm: Dr. Olalekan Odunsi wey be General Secretary for South West Poultry Association of Nigeria (PAN) don call goment make dem facilitate as dem go dey take import animal grade maize and soya meal.

translation.en: Odunsi said the importation would save the poultry industry from collapsing.
translation.pcm: Odunsi tok say na di importation fit save di poultry business from collapse.

translation.en: He said the urgent importation of animal feed grade of maize would sustain the over 50million layers, 100million broilers, 1million breeders and other classes of poultry until the next harvest season.
translation.pcm: He tok say di importation of feed grade maize go  sustain di ova 500 million layers, 100 million broilers, 1 million breeders and oda class of poultry  until next harvest.

translation.en: He also urged the government, in the interim, to enforce a ban on export of soya, seed and processed soya bean meal.
translation.pcm: He also urge government say, for di main time, make dem no allow dem to export soya, seed and soya bean meal wey dem don process.

translation.en: He enjoined governors in the region to put as much efforts to the cultivation of maize as they had done with rice.
translation.pcm: He beg governors for di region make dem pu effort for di production of maize as dem do for di production of rice.

translation.en: Odunsi stressed the need for a strong collaboration among maize farmers in Nigeria, soya bean farmers and others.
translation.pcm: Odunsi put mouth say maize farmers, soya bean farmers and di ones wey remain for Naija need to collabo to take work.

translation.en: He said acute scarcity and astronomical prices of soya beans and maize would threaten additional five million poultry jobs in the short term if the government does not intervene.
translation.pcm: He tok say if government no intervene, say scarcity and hish price of maize and soya go threaten anoda five million poultry jobs if government no do anytin about am.

translation.en: Today, maize is sold at N210, 000/MT in most states of South-West, soya meal N240, 000/MT.
translation.pcm: Today, na 210,000/MT dem dey sell maize for inside most state for South West, soye bena na 240,000/MT.

translation.en: Due to the importance of these two items, the price of poultry feed has continuously been on the increase from N2750 to N3000 in April N2020 to N4850 to N5300 now.
translation.pcm: As di two item take important reach, di price for poultry feed just dey increaese from from N2750 to N3000 for April N2020 to N4850 to N5300 now.

translation.en: In December, most farmers were unable to sell their broilers because the cost of production was higher than what an average Nigerian could afford.
translation.pcm: For December, most farmer no fit sell dem broilers bkos of di cost of production don pass wetin ordinary Naija pesin fit buy.

translation.en: Presently, egg is going out of the reach of an average family with ideal price at N1, 300.
translation.pcm: Presently, egg don dey pass wetin average pesin fit buy, di price na around 1,300

translation.en: So we really need government's intervention to save the current 10million jobs in the poultry value chain of our economy,
translation.pcm: so we really need make goment intervene to save di remaining ten million jobs for inside di poultry value chain for di economy.

translation.en: he said
translation.pcm: as he take tok

translation.en: Pro-Buhari rep suspended from APC
translation.pcm: Dem don suspend rep wey dey support Buhari fom APC

translation.en: The All Progressives Congress (APC) has suspended a member of the House of Representatives representing Kazaure Federal Constituency in Jigawa State, Muhammad Gudaji Danbaffa for six months.
translation.pcm: Di All Progressives Congress (APC) don suspend di member of house of Representative wey dey represent Kazaure federal constituency for inside Jigawa state, Muhammad Gudaji Danbaffa for six month.

translation.en: In addition, a seven-member investigative panel has been constituted to probe the allegation of insubordination against the lawmaker and make its recommendations within 10 days.
translation.pcm: In addition, dem don form one panel wey get seven member to probe di allegation of insurbordination wey dem charge di member with, plus make dem make recommendation inside ten days.

translation.en: The committee is headed by Hamza Dand with Sanusi Kazaure as Secretary.
translation.pcm: Na Hamza Dand head di committee, wey Sanusi Kaaure be secretary.

translation.en: In the letter suspending the lawmaker, the local government chairman of the party, Hassan Lawal, claimed that the decision to suspend Gudaji was initiated by his Kazaure Yamma ward and endorsed by the local government chapter of the party.
translation.pcm: For di leta wey dem take suspend di lawmaker, di oga chairmo for di local government, claim say as dem take decide to suspend Gudaji, say na im constituent pipo for Kazaure Yama ward start am, and local goment sef put hand.

translation.en: Our correspondent reports that the lawmaker was accused of criticising the governor for allegedly subverting the peoples will in the choice of candidates for the chairmanship and councillorship in the recently conducted party primaries in the state.
translation.pcm: Our correspondent report say dem suspend di lawmaker bikos dem accuse am say he criticise di governor, say di governor go change di candidate wey di pipo want for di chaimanship and councilorship primariy wey dem just vote.

translation.en: Serena sails past teenager Pigato in Parma WTA
translation.pcm: Serena don cruise pass teenager Pigato for Parma Wta.

translation.en: Serena Williams brushed aside the challenge of local teenager Lisa Pigato in the opening round of the WTA tournament in Parma on Monday.
translation.pcm: Serena Williams be brush aside di challenge of local teenager Lisa Pigato for di opening round of di WTA tournament inside Parma on Monday.

translation.en: Williams, ranked eighth in the world, beat the 572nd-ranked Pigato, making her WTA debut, 6-3, 6-2 in the first meeting between the two players.
translation.pcm: Williams wey be nomba for di world na im beat Pigato wey rank 572 and wey dey make her WTA debut 6-3,6-2, for di first meeting wey apun between di two of dem.

translation.en: How North-Central govs can optimize open grazing ban in South APC leader
translation.pcm: How North-Central govs dem fit optimize open grazing ban from South APC leader

translation.en: As open grazing controversy trends in the public domain, with Southern governors slamming a ban on it during their meeting in Asaba, the president, Farmers Empowerment Association in Nigeria (FEAN), and Chairman of All Progressives Congress (APC) North-Central Forum in FCT, Honourable Obaje David, examines how the North-Central governors could respond to the ban.
translation.pcm: As open grazing controversy don trend enter public domain, wey Southern governor dem don hit am with ban  durin dem meeting inside Asaba, di president, Farmers Empowerment Association in Nigeria (FEAN), plus Chairman of All Progressives Congress (APC) North-Central Forum in FCT, Honourable Obaje David, don examine how di North-Central governors fit respond to di ban.

translation.en: Recently, the Southern states governors met in Asaba, Delta State, and banned open grazing to stem farmers-herders crisis and other forms of criminalities.
translation.pcm: Recently, di  governor dem for Southern state be meet for Asaba, Delta State, and dem ban open grazing to take cut farmers-herders crisis plus includin oda form of criminality dem.

translation.en: What is your take on the heated controversy generated by this decision?
translation.pcm: Wetin be your take on top  di  controversy wey dis  decision generate?

translation.en: Every human being has right to actions and  opinions.
translation.pcm: evri human being get right for action and opinion.

translation.en: But the most important thing is that once you take your action, you should be aware of the consequences.
translation.pcm: But di most important thing be say once you take your own action, make you know consequence go dey.

translation.en: You should be able to consider the advantages and disadvantages.
translation.pcm: You suppose fit consider di advantage and disadvantage.

translation.en: I am not one of those that say it is good or bad.
translation.pcm: I no be one of dose wey go tok say e good or e bad.

translation.en: As a Nigerian, you have the right and liberty to live anywhere in the country in good faith and enjoy the freedom of association.
translation.pcm: As a Nigerian, na your  right and liberty to live for anywia for inside di kontri with good faith and enjoy di freedom of association.

translation.en: On  this basis, I will not say that it is a good thing.
translation.pcm: For  dis basis, I no go tell you say na good thing.

translation.en: But as a leader in the North Central, I will say that it is a good thing, especially for the North Central Zone, due to the potential economic benefits for us and the nation.
translation.pcm: But as a leader for North Central, I go tok say na good thing, especially for North central zone, as per di potential economic benefit for us and di nation.

translation.en: The ban is an advantage for us.
translation.pcm: Di ban na advantage to us.

translation.en: We need to tap into it and see how we can make it a real venture and make money from it.
translation.pcm: We need to tap into it and see how we fit make am real venture and make money from am.

translation.en: Luckily for us, we have a landmass that is enough to accommodate the herders, no matter the number that may troop from the South into the North Central.
translation.pcm: Luckily for us, we get a landmass wey dey enough to accommodate di herder dem, no matter di nomba wey troop from di South enter di North Central.

translation.en: What then is your position on open grazing?
translation.pcm: Wetin beyour position about open grazing?

translation.en: I am not one of the propagators of open grazing.
translation.pcm: I no be one of di pipo wey dey support open grazing.

translation.en: I believe more in ranching, which I practise as an individual.
translation.pcm: I believe more in ranching, bikos na im I de do.

translation.en: I believe that if we take to ranching, it  will work out for us.
translation.pcm: I believe say if we begin do ranching, e go work out for us.

translation.en: The North Central governors should accommodate the national programme on ranching.
translation.pcm: Make di governors for  North Central allow di national programme on top ranching.

translation.en: Such move could make the North Central a cattle hub where people could always have access to cattle and all the allied products
translation.pcm: Dis kind move fit make Nortj Central di place wey cow plenty pass, wia pipo fit dey buy cow and some allied products

translation.en: and then it becomes a means of economic empowerment for the North Central people.
translation.pcm: E go kom bikom means of economic empowerment, for north central pipo.

translation.en: We have the land, which the southern states may not have.
translation.pcm: We get di land wey southern states dem fit no get.

translation.en: Look at Kogi, Niger, Kwara and others.
translation.pcm: See for Kogi, Niger, Kwara, plus oda state dem.

translation.en: We can conveniently accommodate the herders and ranching policy to our advantage.
translation.pcm: We fut give di herder pipo house, and ranch make e for be awa own advantage.

translation.en: The challenges that the Fulani herders pose are not because they don't want to adopt ranching.
translation.pcm: Di challenges wey dey follow di Fulani herders no be bikos dem no wan adopt ranching.

translation.en: The problem is that they are not being educated on its advantages.
translation.pcm: Di problem be say dem no really educate dem on top di advantage.

translation.en: They have a nomadic culture.
translation.pcm: Dem culture dey nomadic.

translation.en: As a result, they have to be well educated to embrace ranching.
translation.pcm: As aresult, dem need beta education make dem for accept ranching.

translation.en: We can also adopt the Kenya method, where nearly all the families have ranches and you don't see open grazing despite the large number of the cattle they have.
translation.pcm: We fit also adopt di method for Kenya, wey almost all family get cow, but you no fit  still see open grazing, as cow take plenty there reach.

translation.en: But that is what the southern governors were making case for?
translation.pcm: Na wetin di southern governor dem dey tok be dat.

translation.en: The governors were not categorical in this regard.
translation.pcm: Di governor dem no show wia dem belong  in dis regard.

translation.en: They were not calling for ranching and for the federal government to come in.
translation.pcm: Dem no call for ranching or to say make federal government for put mouth.

translation.en: What they were simply saying was that the herders have become problems to us and should go away.
translation.pcm: Wetin dem dey tok be say di herder pipo don bikom problem for us, and make dem komot.

translation.en: They said the herders should apply for land with a claim that herding is a private business.
translation.pcm: Dem tok say make herders kom apply for land, say herding na personal business.

translation.en: But have they asked their indigenes to apply for land like the herders?
translation.pcm: But shey dem don ask dem pipo to apply for land like di herders?

translation.en: As one of those involved in youth empowerment programmes, especially in the agricultural sector  and its value chains, why are some government policies failing to realise their objectives and what is the way out?
translation.pcm: As one of di pesin wey join for youth empowerment, especially for agriculture and value chain waka, why some government policy no really work, wetin be di way out?

translation.en: Firstly, there is no administration that has been able to touch the lives of individuals like President Muhammadu Buhari's administration whereby you can conveniently sit in your house and apply for facilities and you get them.
translation.pcm: Firstly, no other administration don touch  able to touch di lives of individual like one of President Muhammadu Buhari, wey you fit sit for your house without wahala and apply for facility and you go get am.

translation.en: There is also the targeted credit facility which is also known as COVID-19 loan.
translation.pcm: Also some credit facility wey dem dey call COVID-19 loan sef dey.

translation.en: Many Nigerians have conveniently gotten the loan in hundreds of thousands of naira from the comfort of their homes without even going to offices.
translation.pcm: Many Naija pipo don dey collect di loan for plenty hundred of thousands of naira from inside of dem house without sat dem dey go offices.

translation.en: Also, with SMEs being expanded such as the Bank of Industry (BOI), Bank of Agriculture (BOA) and others.
translation.pcm: Also, with say dem don dey expand some SMEs like di Bank of Industry (BOI), Bank of Agriculture (BOA) and di remaining.

translation.en: The challenge is that we have two sides of those that would believe in you and those that would criticise you.
translation.pcm: Di challenge be say, we get two sides, dos wey go believe you and dos wey no go believe.

translation.en: So, for those who don't believe in Buhari's administration, there is nothing beneficial.
translation.pcm: So, for dos wey no get believe for di administration of Buhari, notin get benefit.

translation.en: But for us that believe in Buhari, we are benefiting and we thank God for it.
translation.pcm: But for us wey believe in Buhari, we dey benefit, and we thank god for am.

translation.en: Kidnappers kill driver, abduct 13 in Nasarawa
translation.pcm: Kidnapper dem don kill driver, carry 13 pipo for inside Nasarawa.

translation.en: Kidnappers have shot dead a driver, Adamu Usman, and abducted 13 passengers near Shafa-Abakpa -Umaisha road in Toto Local Government Council of Nasarawa State.
translation.pcm: Kidnapper don kill Adamu Usman, and dem don carry 13 pipo near  Shafa-Abakpa -Umaisha road for Toto Local Government Council of Nasarawa State.

translation.en: Daily Trust learnt that the deceased who was shot three times on his abdomen died at about 9pm at the University of Abuja Teaching Hospital in Gwagwalada where he and one other driver, Attahiru Abukwo, who was also shot, were receiving treatment.
translation.pcm: Daily Trust hear say dem shoot am three times for im abdomen and e die around 9pm for university fo Abuja Teaching Hospital wia im and anoda driver Atahiru Abukwo wey dem shoot too be dey receive treatment together.

translation.en: A driver who narrowly escaped the attack, Ibrahim Saidu, said the incident happened around 5pm on Tuesday when the kidnappers in their large number, wielding AK-47 rifles, emerged from the bush to lay ambush on four vehicles coming from Ugya village.
translation.pcm: Another driver wey narrowly escape di attack Ibrahim Saidu tok say na aound 5pm on tuesday di incident apun, when plenty kidnapper with AK47 kom from inside bush to waylay four moto wey from Ugya village kom.

translation.en: According to him, the kidnappers laid ambush and opened fire on the vehicles that were conveying passengers from Ugya to Abaji.
translation.pcm: As e take tok am, di kidnapper waylay di vehicle and begin shoot gun for moto wey dey carry pipo from Ugya enter Abaji.

translation.en: He said the kidnappers immediately surrounded the vehicles after the drivers lost control and skidded to a halt in the bush.
translation.pcm: E tok say di kidnapper be surround di vehicle afta driver dem don loss control drive enter bush.

translation.en: They whisked away 13 passengers including a middle-aged woman into the bush at gunpoint.
translation.pcm: Dem carry 13 passengers wey include one woman wey neva too old inside bush as dem point gun to dem.

translation.en: In fact, I was driving behind the four vehicles in front of me, but it was God that saved me when I stopped at one of the villages to pick a passenger.
translation.pcm: In fact, u be dey drive behind di four moto, na God save me say I carry persin for one of di village.

translation.en: As I was coming, I heard gunshots and immediately made a U-turn, he said.
translation.pcm: As I dey kom na im I hear say dem dey shoot gun, na so I turn back.

translation.en: The Ohimegye of Opanda-Umaisha, His Royal Majesty (HRM), Usman Abdullahi, said some remnants of bandits inside a forest along the axis have been responsible for kidnapping of travellers, residents as well as farmers in the area.
translation.pcm: Di Ohimegye of Opanda-Umaisha, His Royal Majesty (HRM), Usman Abdullahi, tok say na some bandits wey remain for inside di forest dey responsible for kidnapping of travelers, resident and some farmer for di area.

translation.en: There are some remnants of these bandits that are still terrorising our people along this axis, so I am appealing to the state government to collaborate with the federal government to see how the bandits can be flushed out completely, he said.
translation.pcm: he tok say some bandit dem still remain and dem dey do terror for di  community, beg state and federal government to collaborate take flush dem out patapata.

translation.en: When contacted, the spokesman of the Nasarawa State police command, ASP Ramhan Nansel, said he was yet to be briefed on the latest kidnap incident, adding that he would reach out to the Divisional Police Officer (DPO) of Toto Local Government to get details about it and get back to our reporter.
translation.pcm: As we  contact di spokesman for di Nasarawa State police command, ASP Ramhan Nansel, he tok say dem neva tell am naything about di latest kidnap incident, he tok say he go follow di Divisional Police Officer for inside Toto Local Goment Area tok, and e go follow news pipo tok again.

translation.en: Man arrested for allegedly driving against traffic in Lagos
translation.pcm: Dem don arrest man wey follow one way for inside lagos.

translation.en: The Lagos State Police Command has confirmed the arrest of one Victor Ebhomenyen for allegedly driving against traffic at Four Point Hotel, Oniru in Lagos State.
translation.pcm: Di Lagos State Police Command don confirm di arrest of one Victor Ebhomenyen seek of say im  drive follow one way for Four Point Hotel, Oniru inside Lagos State.

translation.en: Ebhomenyen was alleged to have also assaulted and caused  severe bodily injuries on ASP Erhator Sunday at Four Point Hotel, Oniru, Lagos.
translation.pcm: Dem tok say Ebhomenyen also assault and kos  severe injury for ASP Erhator Sunday bodi at Four Point Hotel, Oniru, Lagos.

translation.en: This is contained in a statement signed by the  Lagos Police Command's Spokesperson, CSP Olumuyiwa Adejobi.
translation.pcm: Dis one dey for inside one statement wey Lagos Police Command toktok pesin  CSP Olumuyiwa Adejobi put hand, .

translation.en: He said that the command deemed it necessary to react and set the record straight regarding
translation.pcm: He tok say di command thnik am say make dem set di record straught concerning

translation.en: the incident that was captured in a video that went viral on the social media on Saturday April 17.
translation.pcm: di incident wey dem record for video wey enter internet for social media kom go viral on Saturday April 17.

translation.en: He said two men assaulted ASP Erhator Sunday, an officer on duty, and created a scene on the road at Oniru, Victoria Island, Lagos State.
translation.pcm: E tok say two men be assault  ASP Erhator Sunday, officer wey dey for duty, and dem create scene for road at Oniru, Victoria Island, Lagos State.

translation.en: Adejobi said that  the prime suspect, Victor, was  in police custody at the State Criminal Investigation Department Panti, for investigation and prosecution as and when due.
translation.pcm: Adejobi tok say di prime suspect, Victor, don enter police net for State Criminal Investigation Department Panti, for investigation and prosecution as and when due.

translation.en: He added that the command was making efforts to arrest his fleeing accomplice, Etinosa.
translation.pcm: E tok say di command don dey make effort to arrest di persin wey dem do di gbege togeda, wey be Etinosa.

translation.en: Gbajabiamila welcomes Ayade's defection as PDP urges members to stay united
translation.pcm: Gbajabiamila don welkom as Ayade take defect  as PDP dey urge member say make dem stay unite.

translation.en: The Speaker of the House of Representatives, Rep. Femi Gbajabiamila, has expressed joy over the defection of the Governor of Cross River State, Prof. Ben Ayade, to the All Progressives Congress (APC), saying the party is opened to all.
translation.pcm: Di Speaker for inside  House of Representatives, Rep. Femi Gbajabiamila, don show say e hapi as di Governor of Cross River State, Prof. Ben Ayade,  take defect enter di All Progressives Congress (APC), im tok say di parti open to evribodi.

translation.en: Gbajabiamila in a statement on Thursday by his Special Adviser on Media and Publicity, Lanre Lasisi, said Ayade's action has once again shown that APC was the party to beat in the country.
translation.pcm: Gbajabiamila for inside one  statement on Thursday wey im Special Adviser on top Media and Publicity, Lanre Lasisi, tok say wetin Ayade do don show say APC  na dem be di parti to beat for inside di kontri .

translation.en: The Speaker said the Cross River State governor has taken the right decision and shown a good example for others to follow.
translation.pcm: Di Speaker tok say di Cross River State governor don take di korekt decision and he don show beta example make  di remaining dem for take follow.

translation.en: He said the ruling party remains open to all, calling on well-meaning Nigerians to join the APC to move the country forward.
translation.pcm: He tok say di ruling parti remain open for all, he callbeta Nigerians dem to join di APC to move di country forward.

translation.en: The Speaker noted that APC will continue to be just and fair to all its members.
translation.pcm: Di Speaker tok say  APC go  continue to dey just and fair to all members dem.

translation.en: Meanwhile, the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), while reacting to Ayade's defection, urged its members in Cross River State stay united.
translation.pcm: Meanwhile, di Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), wen dem  react to di defect wey Ayade defect , urge member for inside Cross River State make dem stay unite.

translation.en: In a statement by the spokesman of the Party, Kola Ologbondiyan said, Our party calls on all critical stakeholders and teeming members of our party in Cross Rivers State to immediately pull together and ensure that all structure of our party in the state remain intact.
translation.pcm: For inside one statment wey di parti toktok pesin, Kola Ologbondiyan put mouth, awa parti dey call on all critical stakeholder and teeming member of awa parti for  inside Cross Rivers State to immediately pull togeda and ensure say all structure of awa parti for inside di state remain intact.

translation.en: The PDP wishes Governor Ayade well in his new political sojourn as well as in his future endeavours.
translation.pcm: Di  PDP wish Governor Ayade well in his new political waka  as well as in his future endeavours.

translation.en: Passage of forensic Bill by National Assembly: Its relevance to Buhari's fight against corruption
translation.pcm: Di forensic Bill wey National Assembly wan pass: E dey relevant to di fight against corruption wey Buhari dey do

translation.en: The National Assembly of the Federal Republic of Nigeria on Wednesday 19th
translation.pcm: Di National Assembly of di Federal Republic of Nigeria for  Wednesday 19th

translation.en: May 2021 at the House of Representatives and Tuesday 2nd
translation.pcm: May 2021 for di House of Representatives and Tuesday 2nd

translation.en: March 2021 at the Senate made history by passing into law, the Chartered Institute of Forensic and Investigative Professionals of Nigeria Bill, 2021 (SB.615 and HB.
translation.pcm: March 2021 for di Senate made history wen dem pass  into law, di Chartered Institute of Forensic and Investigative Professionals of Nigeria Bill, 2021 (SB.615 and HB.

translation.en: 791), after it was read for the Third Time in both Chambers (SENATE AND HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVE).
translation.pcm: 791), afta dem read am for di Third Time for di both Chambers (SENATE AND HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVE).

translation.en: This act is a clear demonstration of the National Assembly's patriotism and direct response, targeted at strengthening and re-invigorating national frontiers in the fight against fraud, corruption and cybercrimes, which has eaten deep into the fabric of our nation.
translation.pcm: Dis act na clear demonstration of  di patriotism and direct response of di National Assembly, wey dem take target, plus strengthening and re-invigorating national frontiers for di fight against fraud, corruption and cybercrimes, wey don enter awa kontri waka welwel.

translation.en: With the passage of this Bill, the 9th Assembly under the distinguished and able leadership of His Excellency, Senator Ahmad Ibrahim Lawan, PhD, CON and Rt Hon Femi Gbajabiala have shown clearly, its ardent resolve to carry out its legislative functions in line with the provision of the Constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria 1999, as amended.
translation.pcm: As dem don pass dis bill, di 9th Assembly under di distinguished and able leadership of His Excellency, Senator Ahmad Ibrahim Lawan, PhD, CON and Rt Hon Femi Gbajabiala don show clearly say, say dem don carry dem legislative function for head, as e take be for inside di Constitution of di Federal Republic of Nigeria 1999, as dem take amend am.

translation.en: And this also attests to the fact that the National Assembly is alive to the performance of its complementary role(s) with other arms of Government in the fight against corruption.
translation.pcm: And dis also attests to di fact say di National Assembly don wake to di performance of dem complementary role with oda arms of Goment for di fight against corruption.

translation.en: It is with great delight and a deep sense of gratitude that I write this, which has been put together as a platform for us to let Nigerians and indeed the whole world know what the Chartered Institute of Forensic and Investigative Professionals of Nigeria is all about and the unique concept we are bringing on board in order to complement national efforts in its quest to ride the country of corruption, fraud and Cyber-Crimes and other related crimes.
translation.pcm: Na wit hapi mind  and wit deep sense of gratitude dat I write dis, which has been put togeda as a platform for us to let Nigerians and indeed the whole world know what di Chartered Institute of Forensic and Investigative Professionals of Nigeria is all about and di unique concept we are bringing on board in order to complement national efforts in its quest to ride di kontri of corruption, fraud and Cyber-Crimes and oda related crimes.

translation.en: After the passage of this Bill by the Senate, and in view of the fact that we operate a bi-cameral Legislature, the ever-ready and resilient House of Representatives, under the able leadership of His Excellency, Rt.
translation.pcm: Afta di senate dem don pass di Bill, and for view say na bi-cameral Legislature we dey operate, di  House of Representatives we dey always ready and resilient, under di able leadership of His Excellency, Rt.

translation.en: Femi Gbajabiamila, the Hon.
translation.pcm: Femi Gbajabiamila, wey  be di Hon.

translation.en: Speaker, followed suit and passed the Bill on Wednesday 19th May, 2021.
translation.pcm: Di speaker sef follow wetin dem do and he pass di Bill on Wednesday 19th May, 2021.

translation.en: As you may well be aware, the Bill to establish the Chartered Institute of Forensic and Investigative Professionals of Nigeria (CIFIPN) has been one of the most viciously attacked and antagonised bill in the National Assembly in recent times.
translation.pcm: As una fit don hear before, di Bill wey dem wan take establish di Chartered Institute of Forensic and Investigative Professionals of Nigeria (CIFIPN) dey among di bill wey dem don tok NO to for inside National Assembly.

translation.en: Sadly the attacks came from those who ought to be partners in progress in the fight against endemic corruption in Nigeria, but have rather designated themselves as enemies of the general good.
translation.pcm: Di sad thing be say na pipo wey suppose dey put mouth for di fight against corrupt waka for inside Naija dey attack di bill, dem don turn to enemy for common ood.

translation.en: Good is good it has no substitute so also is bad.
translation.pcm: Gud thing na gud thing, e no get substitute, na so bad thing sef be.

translation.en: No matter how long it takes, good always prevails over bad just as the superiority of light over darkness remain constant and unquestionable
translation.pcm: No mata as e take long reach, good go always prevails ova bad just as di light superior ova darknes take dey constant and unquestionable

translation.en: It is indeed important for us to have a glimpse of how it all happened at the National Assembly.
translation.pcm: e dey important say say make we see small of how e take happen for di National Assembly.

translation.en: Interestingly, The Chartered Institute of Forensic and Investigative Professionals of Nigeria (Est) Bill 2021 (CIFIPN) was first passed into law by the 9th Senate on the 2nd day of March, 2021 having undergone the rigour of legislative processes of 1st Reading, 2nd Reading and eventual at its 3rd Reading on the 2nd March, 2021 the bill was unanimously passed into law by the Nigeria Senate having deeply considered the urgent need for this noble legislation, of course this was not without series of thunder bolts from detractors who would not stop at any length to see that any legislation that would be helpful in assisting the Buhari-led administration to fight corruption does not see the light of the day but the senate stood firm and saw it through.
translation.pcm: E dey interestin say, di Chartered Institute of Forensic and Investigative Professionals of Nigeria (Est) Bill 2021 (CIFIPN) na di 9th Senate first pass am into law  on di 2nd day of March, 2021 as e done pass di  legislative processes of 1st Reading, 2nd Reading and eventual for di 3rd Reading on di 2nd March, 2021 senate dem pass di Bill  into law  wit one voice when dem don consider di urgent need  for di noble legislation, of kos no be sauy e apun without plenty  thunder bolts from detractors  wey no go stop at any lenght to see say any legislation wey go help di administration wey Buhari lead to fight corruption no see see light of day but senate stand welwel and dem see am through.

translation.en: It is very important for the public to know that (CIFIPN) is not just a noble body but a novel one in Nigeria that is targeted at bridging the gap that has long been existing in the forensics space.
translation.pcm: E dey very important for make public know say (CIFIPN) no be just any noble bodi but a new one for Naija wey dem target say make e bridge di gap wey don dey for long for di forensics space.

translation.en: Today, the journey to having a standard body that would regulate the practice of forensics in Nigeria is at its peak and Nigerians must rise to challenge the few anti-government bodies that would want to sabotage this step.
translation.pcm: Today, di waka to get one standard bodi wey go dey regulate di practice of forensics for Naija for im peak and make Naija pipo rise make dem challenge di few anti-goment bodi wey fit intend to sabotage dis step.

translation.en: The passage of this Bill by the National Assembly, no doubt, is a clear demonstration of its patriotic zeal and the need to further strengthen all national efforts geared towards the fight against corruption, which has hindered development in every aspect of our national lives.
translation.pcm: Dis bill wey National Assembly don pass, show say clearly dem demonstrate say dem dey patriotic and di need to strengthen national efforts against corruption, wey don stand dey block development for evri aspect of awa national live.

translation.en: This legislative bold step, taken by the two Chambers of the National Assembly, is quite historic and symbolic, coming at a time that Nigeria is in dire need of legislation(s)
translation.pcm: Dis beta step for inside legislation , wey di two Chambers of di National Assembly take, dey historic and symbolic, e dey happen at a time wey Nigeria dey need legislation welwel.

translation.en: that will give more bite to its anti-corruption drive in view of the raising spate of criminal and corrupt practices, across the globe.
translation.pcm: dat one go give beta way for im anti-corruption drive as di spate of criminal and corrupt waka don rise across di globe.

translation.en: As we all know, crime generally, has assumed a new dimension, due to advancement in science and technology in the 21st Century.
translation.pcm: As we all sabi, crime don enter anoda level as science and technology don improve for 21st century.

translation.en: Therefore, the passage of this Bill is apt and timely and it has shown clearly that we have flexible and responsive Legislature that is in tune and in touch with emerging global realities and ever-ready to enact legislations that will meet the yearnings and aspirations of Nigerians.
translation.pcm: Therefore, as dem pass di bill dey gud and e apun for beta time, plus e don show clearly say we get flexible and responive legislature wey sabi di thing wey dey apun for di world, and dem dey redi to do legislation wey go meet wetin Nigeria pipo dey talk.

translation.en: It is apposite to also state that the journey, which culminated into the passage of this Bill, began in the 8th National Assembly whereby, our Bill was sponsored by Distinguished Senator Ahmad Ibrahim Lawan, Ph.D, CON, the current President of Senate when he was a Senate Leader, because of its strategic importance to the anti-corruption drive of this administration.
translation.pcm: Make we also tok say di journey wey dey for inside as dem take pass di bill make e for turn to law, don start since di 8th National Assembly, wia Distinguished Senator Ahmad Ibrahim Lawan Ph.D, CON wey be current Senate President sponsor awa bill, when he be senate Leader, bikos e dey important to di anti corruption waka of dis admiistration.

translation.en: For the benefit of hindsight, when our Bill was introduced in the two Chambers during the 8th National Assembly, all-inclusive public hearings were conducted by the relevant Committees of the respective Chambers.
translation.pcm: For beta understandin, when we be introduce awa bill for inside di two chamber durin di 8th Assembly, dem do public hearin wey carry evribodi along for inside di chamber.

translation.en: Thereafter and in spite of opposition from stakeholders who were in the minority, led by the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria (ICAN), the National Assembly passed the Bill, in view of its significance and the part it will play in the fight against corruption.
translation.pcm: Thereafter, and ontop say minority pipo wey be stakeholder oppose am, na Institute of Chatered Accountants of Nigeria (ICAN) lead dem, di National Assembly pass di bill, with view of how e take get significance and di part wey go play for di fight against corruption.

translation.en: Afterward, the Bill was forwarded to Mr President for Presidential Assent, which was not given before the Dissolution of the 8th National Assembly in June, 2019.
translation.pcm: Afterward, dem forward di bill give oga Presido, make e for put hand, but e neva put hand before dem scatter di 8th Assembly for inside June 2019.

translation.en: It is on the strength of this, that the Bill was re-introduced in this 9th National Assembly and this time around, it was sponsored by Distinguished Senator Abdullahi A. Yahaya, the current Leader of the Senate, in view of the importance attached to it.
translation.pcm: Na on dis stregth dem take bring di bill abck for di 9th National Assembly, na Distinguished Senator Abdullahi A. Yahaya, di current Leader for di Senate, in view of as e take dey important.

translation.en: We are constrained to make this clarification in order to clear the air on the cheap propaganda being propelled by our detractors that our Bill was rejected by the 8th National Assembly.
translation.pcm: We dey pushed to make dis clarification in order to clear di air on di cheap cheap propaganda wey pipo wey dey distract us dey tok say di 8th Assembly don reject awa bill.

translation.en: Also worthy of mention is the fact that our Bill has being mistaken for similar Bills, which were recently introduced in both the Senate and the House of Representatives Chambers.
translation.pcm: Also we suppose mention di fact say dem don mistake awa bill with abother bill dem wey dey similar wey dem just introduce for both di senate and House of Represntative Chambers.

translation.en: These Bills, upon our close scrutiny, we discovered that they are merely duplications of the intents and purports of our Bill.
translation.pcm: Dis bill dem, as we don scrutize dem with close eye, we discover say dem just copy awa intention and di thing wey awa bill stand for.

translation.en: It must be stressed that none of these Bills were introduced in the 8th National Assembly, other than our Bill.
translation.pcm: We suppose draw hear tok am say dem no introduce any of di bills dem for inside 8th Assembly, na only awa bill.

translation.en: As such, we are the first to ever come up with a Bill of this magnitude,(Forensic)
translation.pcm: As such, na we be di first to carry bill wey big reach like dis (Forensic)

translation.en: having seen the urgent need to establish such great Institute.
translation.pcm: As we don see say e dey very urgent to establish dat kind great Institute.

translation.en: The decision to establish the Institute was taken after a painstaking study of how the Institutes operate in other jurisdictions and how well they have helped in crime detection, investigation and prosecution.
translation.pcm: Dem take di decision wey dem take establish di Institute afta dem study how di Institute dey take operate for other jurisdiction and how dem don take help crime detection, investigation and prosecution.

translation.en: It is instructive to note that our Institute has been in existence since 2009.
translation.pcm: Na part of instruction make dem for know say awa Institute don dey since 2009.

translation.en: And over the years, we have trained professionals in the field of forensic science and technology, targeted at inculcating the requisite skills and acumen in the pragmatic areas of forensic investigation and management, to wit:
translation.pcm: And over di years, And over di years, we don train professionala to sabi forensic science technology, targeted at inculcatin di requisite skil dem for di pragmatic areas of forensic investigation and management, to wit:

translation.en: forensic analysis to eliminate material misstatement, whether caused by error or fraud; voice recognition analysis; fingerprint/signature analysis; digital forensic and cybersecurity; crime scene investigation; global anti-corruption compliance and enforcement; litigation support, forensic investigation capacities, preparation of forensic reports, fraud risk management, corporate fraud analysis, fraud prevention, detection and investigation, etc.
translation.pcm: make dem fit take forensic analysis eliminate material misstatement, whether na by error or fraud; voice recognition analysis; fingerprint/signature analysis; digital forensic and cybersecurity; crime scene investigation; global anti-corruption compliance and enforcement; litigation support, forensic investigation capacities, preparation of forensic reports, fraud risk management, corporate fraud analysis, fraud prevention, detection and investigation etc.

translation.en: You will agree with me that in today's world, the conventional ways of investigating crimes, with a view to fighting it has become obsolete.
translation.pcm: You go follow me reason say for inside di obodo world wey we dey today, di normal way wey we dey take investigate crime, on to say we want stop am don bikom old something.

translation.en: As such, for us as a nation to do something meaningful in this regard, it is paramount that we align ourselves with the global trend and emerging innovations, targeted at fighting corruption.
translation.pcm: As such, make we as a kontri for do something wey get meanin for dis matter, e dey paramount say make we follow global trend and new innovations, wey dem put for ground to take fight corruption.

translation.en: It is in line with this reasoning that the idea of establishing this Institute was conceived with a well-structure laudable objectives that are relevant to the anti-corruption drive of this administration.
translation.pcm: Na dis kind way we take reason to establish dis Institute wey get betta objective dat is relevant to di anti-corruption agenda of dis administration.

translation.en: Time will not permit me to highlight all the objectives of the Bill here.
translation.pcm: Time no too dey for me to tok about evrithing wey dey inside di bill for here.

translation.en: However, I wish to crave your indulgence to highlight a few of the objectives of the Bill, for the purpose of this address, as follows:
translation.pcm: However, I wan make you allow me to mention few of wetin di Bill go do, for di purpose of dis tok, as e take be like dis:

translation.en: To establish a Chartered Institute of Forensic and Investigative Professionals in Nigeria in order to develop and train Professionals in this specialized field, through systemic and professional examination and certification that will enhance the acquisition of the requisite skills in the use of science and technology for fraud detection, investigation and prevention;
translation.pcm: say make we for establish Chartered Institute of Forensic and Investigative Professionals in Nigeria, to develop and train professional for inside dis specialised field, with systemic and professional examination and certification wey go give better skil inside use of science and technology for fraud detection, investigation and detection;

translation.en: To provide a platform for training and re-training of intending professionals in the usage of Forensic Science and technological tools and techniques in the investigation of frauds in both public and private sectors of our economy, in line with international best practices;
translation.pcm: To provide platform wey dem go dey take train and retrain of pipo wey wan bikom professional on top how dem dey take use Forensic Science and Technology tools and techniques dey investigate fraud for both public and private sector of di economy, as dem dey take do evriwia;

translation.en: To promote high professional standards, ethics and etiquettes amongst practitioners in the field, in a bid to stem fraudulent and corruption practices, and as well develop a mechanism for fraud prevention, as a proactive measure against corruption generally;
translation.pcm: To promote high professional standards, ethics and etiquettes among pipo wey dey do di, in a bid to cut fraudul and corruption waka, and as well develop a mechanism for fraud prevention, as a proactive measure against corruption generally;

translation.en: To fill the existing huge vacuum in our archaic and conventional system of investigation with the introduction of a unique operation of forensic science to help the country from expending its scarce foreign exchange to hire foreign expatriates to do forensic investigations in Nigeria;
translation.pcm: To take fill di huge vacuum wey dey exist for awa  normal system of investigation weu don old with di introduction of a unique operation of forensic science to help di country from expending im scarce foreign exchange to hire foreign expatriates to do forensic investigations for inside Naija;

translation.en: To develop a broad-based mechanism and training programmes that cut across all the strata of our investigation architecture, involving professionals such as Lawyers, Criminologists, Security Experts, Judicial Officers, Court Registrars, and Economists.
translation.pcm: To develop broad-based mechanism and training programmes wey go cut across all di strata of awa investigation architecture, involving professionals such as Lawyers, Criminologists, Security Experts, Judicial Officers, Court Registrars, and Economists.

translation.en: This would enhance effective and efficient disposition of cases in line with global best practices; and
translation.pcm: Dis one go enhance effective plus efficient disposition of cases as dem dey take do am globally; and

translation.en: To enhance Nigerias anti-fraud mechanisms, through the provision of a legal framework for the professional development and discipline of forensic and investigative professionals in Nigeria, among others.
translation.pcm: To take enhance anti-fraud mechanism for Naija, through di provision of a legal framework for di professional development and discipline of forensic and investigative professionals for Naija, among odas.

translation.en: From the foregoing, it is apparent that the role of this Institute is quite strategic and important.
translation.pcm: From di foregoing, e don show say di role of dis Institute dey strategic and important.

translation.en: It is also pertinent to reiterate that forensic science is a very wide and all-encompassing field, which requires effective and efficient regulation for the attainment and sustainability of high level professionalism and ethical standards.
translation.pcm: E also dey important make we tok say forensic science dey very wide and na field wey involve many oda, and e require effective and efficient regulation make we for attain and sustain high level professionalism and ethical standard.

translation.en: The broad spectrum of the scope and focal point of the Institute, includes but not limited to forensic toxicology; forensic investigation; forensic auditing; digital forensics and cybercrimes, forensic autopsy; forensic law; forensic accounting; forensic nursing; forensic pathology; forensic engineering; forensic psychology; forensic DNA analysis; forensic anthropology; forensic linguistics; forensic deontology; forensic dentistry; forensic archeology; forensic graphology, forensic entomology, etc.
translation.pcm: Di broad spectrum of di scope and focal point of di Institute, includes but no be only forensic toxicology; forensic investigation; forensic auditing; digital forensics and cybercrimes, forensic autopsy; forensic law; forensic accounting; forensic nursing; forensic pathology; forensic engineering; forensic psychology; forensic DNA analysis; forensic anthropology; forensic linguistics; forensic deontology; forensic dentistry; forensic archeology; forensic graphology, forensic entomology, etc.

translation.en: Accordingly, you will agree with me that our Institute is bringing on board, a unique concept of crime detection and investigation in conformity with international best practices.
translation.pcm: Accordingly, you go agree say awa Institute don bring unique concept enter crime detection and investigation wey follow international best practices.

translation.en: This concept is far beyond the reasoning of those whose myopic view about the purports of our Bill have beclouded their senses of reasoning, due to narrow-mindedness and inordinate desire to monopolise a system, which is outside their jurisdiction and scope of operations.
translation.pcm: Di concept pass as myopic pipo dey take thingk about awa bill don cover dem sense of thingkin, due to narrow-mindedness and inordinate desire to monopolise a system, wey don pass dem jurisdiction and scope of operation.

translation.en: On a lighter note, I wish to draw the attention of everyone to the funny scenario that is playing out now, and as a matter of fact, it should be a source of concern for all well-meaning Nigerians.
translation.pcm: On a lighter note, I wan draw di attention of evrione to di funny scenario dat is playin out now, and as a matter of fact, e suppose be a source of concern for all beta Naija pipo.

translation.en: When the Chartered Institute of Forensic and Investigative Professionals of Nigeria Bill was introduced in the 8th National Assembly, the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria (ICAN), came out vehemently to oppose its passage because according to them, it is an unnecessary duplication of functions already undertaken by their Institute.
translation.pcm: Wen dem introduce di Chartered Institute of Forensic and Investigative Professionals of Nigeria Bill for di 8th National Assembly, di Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria (ICAN), kom out wit anger to oppose di passage bikos according to dem, na unnecessary duplication of function wey dem Institute don dey do.

translation.en: However, upon the re-introduction of our Bill in this 9th National Assembly, and having seen the overwhelming and accelerated legislative supports, our Bill has received from the two Chambers, ICAN has now realized that forensic science is a unique field of practice, and as we speak, they have introduced a similar Bill that is currently before the House of Representatives, having failed woefully in their attempts to stop the passage of our Bill.
translation.pcm: However, as dem don take introduce awa bill again for dis 9th National Assembly, and as we don see di overwhelmin and accelerated legislative support wey di two Chambers don give awa bill, ICAn don realize say forensic science na uniques field of practice, and as we dey talk, dem don bring similar Bill kom meet di House of Representative, as dem don fail wofully for dem attempt to stop di passage of dis awa bill.

translation.en: One may ask, what has changed between now and the past, where ICAN holds the view that there shouldn't be any Institute other than theirs to regulate the practice of forensic science?
translation.pcm: One fit ask, wetin don change between now and di past, wia ICAN get di view say make any oda Institute no dey regulate di practices of forensic science?

translation.en: your answer is as good as mine.
translation.pcm: Your answer na di same thing with my own.

translation.en: I wish to also inform you that the Association of National Accountants of Nigeria (ANAN), is not left out of this funny theatrical episode.
translation.pcm: I for also like inform you say di Association of National Accountants of Nigeria (ANAN), also dey part of dis di episode.

translation.en: Just like their ICAN counterpart, they have also introduced a Bill in the House of Representatives with the nomenclature the Chartered Institute of Forensic and Certified Fraud Examiners of Nigeria Bill, which was initiated and being promoted by ANAN.
translation.pcm: which was initiated and being promoted by ANAN. Just as dem ICAN counterpart, dey sef don introduce one bill for inside House of Representative wey di same structure with di Chartered Institute of Forensic and Certified Fraud Examiners of Nigeria Bill, wey be na ANAN initiate am, and na dem promote am.

translation.en: I decided to bring out all these facts so that Nigerians and even the international communities will understand the extent to which some people can go in order to achieve their aims.
translation.pcm: I decide say make I tok all di fact dem make Nigeria pipo and even international community for understand di extent to which some pipo fit go say make dem for achieve dem aim.

translation.en: However, we are not perturbed by these developments because we believe in the credibility and ability of the National Assembly and indeed the Presidency to do what is right and not to allow themselves to be manipulated in any way, by these unnecessary distractions, so as not to make a mockery of the entire thing.
translation.pcm: However, dis development no disturb us at all, bikos we believe ontop credibility and ability of di National Assembly and also for di Presidency to do di correct thing, make dem no enter manipulate in any way, with dis unnecessarydistractions dem, make dem for no make mockery of do whole thing.

translation.en: The known practical and antagonist of this Bill has remained ICAN for reason that is now becoming obvious.
translation.pcm: Na ICAN be di practical and antagonist for dis bill and we don dey see di reason now.

translation.en: They engaged several bystanders into writing frivolous petitions some even targeted at the leadership of the Senate with a tone of blackmail.
translation.pcm: Dem engage several bystanders into make dem write bad petition, dem even target di leadership for inside Senate, and e sound like say na bleckmail.

translation.en: Having failed woefully at the senate, the antagonists shifted their attention to the House of Representatives with the same bystanders writing all manner of publication.
translation.pcm: As dem don fail for inside Senate, di antagonist shift attention go House of Representative with di same bystanders as dem just dey write many many publication.

translation.en: Yet again, they failed.
translation.pcm: and again, dem fail.

translation.en: Ordinarily by legislative procedure, a bill that has been passed by the Senate would only require concurrence by the House safe for where there are observations.
translation.pcm: Ordinarily according to legislative procedure, bill wey Senate don passgo only need concurrence by di House except wen dem get observation.

translation.en: But in the case of the CIFIPN Bill, the antagonist fought the passage of the bill until truth prevail and on the 19th May, 2021 the Bill for the establishment of the Chartered Institute of Forensic and Investigative Professionals of Nigeria for Effective Regulation, Registration of Members and Determination of what Standard Knowledge and Skills to be Attained by Persons seeking to become Registered Members and Qualify to Practice as Forensic and Investigative Professionals; and for Related Matters (HB. 791) was passed into law by the House of Representative.
translation.pcm: But for di case of di CIFIPN Bill, di pipo wey dey against am fight am until truth win for 19 day of May, 2021 wey House of Representative pass di Bill establishment of the Chartered Institute of Forensic and Investigative Professionals of Nigeria for Effective Regulation, Registration of Members and Determination of wetin di Standard Knowledge and Skil dem wey pesin wey wan bikom rigistered member must get and Qualify to Practice as Forensic and Investigative Professionals; and for Related Matter (HB. 791)

translation.en: ICAN has now registered its Bill in the House of Representatives titled (REPEALING AND RE-ENACTMENT OF ICANS ACT.
translation.pcm: ICAN don register dem own Bill for inside di House of Respresentatives wey dem title  (REPEALING AND RE-ENACTMENT OF ICANS ACT.

translation.en: This ICAN new Bill has in it full of provision for practice of forensic, and also that they will establish a Forensic University in Nigeria and without which nobody can practice forensic in Nigeria, and violation of this section will lead such a person to some years imprisonment.
translation.pcm: Di new Bill wey ICAn bring get contain full provision to dey take practice forensic, plus say dem wan establish forensic university for inside Nigeria, and without am, nobodi go fit practice forensics for Nigeria, and pesin wey violate am go enter prison for some years.

translation.en: This sounds so strange in a country full of enlightened people.
translation.pcm: Dis wan dey strange for ear for inside kontri wey plenty oepn eye pipo dey.

translation.en: My joy is that Nigeria is not a Banana Republic
translation.pcm: D tin wey make me api be say Nigeria no be Banana Republic

translation.en: no matter the level of corruption therein.
translation.pcm: No mata di level of coruption wey dey dere.

translation.en: We are already challenging the passage of the bills by the House of Representatives.
translation.pcm: We don dey challenge as House of Representatives take pass bill.

translation.en: It should be noted that, our challenging the bill is not borne out of malice or ill will, but because we are certain that the purpose of this bill is to halt presidential assent under the guise of existence of similar legislation.
translation.pcm: We suppose note am say, as we dey challenge di bill no be for bad belle, but bikos say we dey certain say di purpose of di bill na to stop presidential assent under di disguise say similar legislation don dey before.

translation.en: We will not allow ourselves and Nigerians to be deceived by their antics.
translation.pcm: We no go gree make dem deceive us and Naija people with dem wayo.

translation.en: You would recall how ICAN vehemently opposed this enactment of CIFIPN and in one of its sponsored publications by the Association of professional Bodies of Nigeria led by Engr.(Chief)
translation.pcm: You go remember how ICAn take open eye oppose di CIFIPN and for inside one pubication wey dem sponsor by di Association of professional Bodies of Nigeria led by Engr.(Chief)

translation.en: Olumuyiwa Alade on the 24th May, 2019 made frantic efforts to say that ICAN under its enabling laws is empowered to practice Forensics and therefore for CIFIPN Bill to be passed it would amount to duplication of laws, today ICAN is presenting its ACT to be repealed and re-enacted with the inclusion of Forensics in the new law.
translation.pcm: Olumuyiwa Alade on 24th May, 2019 make plenty effort to tell us say di law wey dey enable ICAN don give am power to do forensics and to pass di CIFIPN Bill go be like dem just dey duplicate law, but today ICAN don dey present dem law say make dem for include forensics inside di new law.

translation.en: The question is, what has changed?
translation.pcm: Di question is, wetin don change?

translation.en: The same law that ICAN has always told the public that it has forensics is now seeking for its re-enactment.
translation.pcm: Di same law wey ICAN wey ICAN don tell di public say e get forensics kom dey seek say make dem re-enact am.

translation.en: As always, while we are not opposed to any group proposing the inclusion of forensics in its laws, we are however concerned that a body should not try to perpetuate itself.
translation.pcm: As always, as we no dey oppose any group wey dey propose say make dem include forensics fot dem law, awa concern be say make one bodi no try perpetuate imsef.

translation.en: ICAN and its cohorts have realised their inability to stop the passage of CIFIPN
translation.pcm: ICAN and dem cohorts don realise dem inability to stop di passage of CIFIPN

translation.en: so they want to have a body within itself.
translation.pcm: So dem wan get one union for demsef.

translation.en: What they are scared of is checks and balances, they would not want another professional body to investigate their activities because they know what they are doing to the economy of this nation.
translation.pcm: Na checks and balances dey fear dem, dem no go want want make anoda professional bodi to investigate dia activities bikos dem know wetin dem dey do to di economy of dis nation.

translation.en: How can they want to be a judge in their own case?
translation.pcm: How dem go wan dey judge dem own case by demsef?

translation.en: This sounds so strange.
translation.pcm: Dis one sound strange welwel.

translation.en: On this note, we are calling on the National Assembly to beware of the antics of these groups, they cannot be speaking from both sides of their mouth and expect the National Assembly to be cajoled.
translation.pcm: On dis note, we dey  call on di National Assembly to beware of di wayo wey dis group get, dey no suppose dey talk from both sides of dem mouth,make dem kom dey  expect to use am cajole National Assembly.

translation.en: We want to yet again appreciate the doggedness of the 9th Assembly in ensuring that the Bill is passed, the Nigerian people are more than ever before convinced of the readiness of this administration to combat corruption through every possible means and would at all times encourage legislation that is aimed at achieving this goal.
translation.pcm: Once again, we wan appreciate di commit wey di 9th Assembly put to make sure say dem pass di Bill, Naija pipo don know say dis administration dey ready to fight corruption by evri means and dem go encourage legislation wey dem aim say fit help dem achieve dis goal

translation.en: We are confident that His Excellency, President Muhammadu Buhari will not hesitate in assenting to this Bill as soon as it gets to his desk.
translation.pcm: We get confident say His Excellency, President Muhammadu Buhari no got hesitate to put hand for di Bill as soon as e enter im table

translation.en: We are calling on all Nigerians to come and be part of the Forensics Profession.
translation.pcm: We dey call Naija peipo make dem kom take part for Forensic Profession.

translation.en: The profession is open for all professionals in various field of endeavours.
translation.pcm: Di profession dey open to all professional pipo for different area dem.

translation.en: There is a training arm of the institute that will studiously guide you and equip you.
translation.pcm: Di Institute get trainig section wey go guide and equip una.

translation.en: I wish to thank you all and to also reiterate our resolve and commitment to upholding ethical standards in line with global best practices, in rendering our professional services and trainings that would bring about innovative ways of fighting corruption and financial crimes, generally.
translation.pcm: I wan thank all of una, and also talk am again say we dey commited to stand with ethical standards as e take follow di way dem do am worlwide, as we dey give awa professional services, plus trainin wey go give us new ways to take fight corruption and crime wey be money matter generally.

translation.en: I wish to appeal to all stakeholders and well-meaning Nigerians to support this noble course and to implore us all to make frantic efforts so that collectively, we can surmount the menace of corruption, the plethora of security challenges, across the country and other associated crises.
translation.pcm: I wan appeal give stakeholders and better Naija pipo say make dem support dis noble course, and to beg all of us to make efforts, so dat we go fit finish corruption together, di plenty security wahala, all ova di kontri and oda crises wey follow am.

translation.en: Dr (Mrs) Enape Victoria Ayishetu, PhD, Pro-tem President, (CIFIPN) www.cifipn.org
translation.pcm: Dr (Mrs) Enape Victoria Ayishetu, PhD, Pro-tem President, (CIFIPN) www.cifipn.org

translation.en: Air Peace conducts test flights with new E195-E2 Aircraft
translation.pcm: Air peace don do test test flight with dem new Aircraft wey be E195-E2

translation.en: Air Peace has commenced test flights for its two brand new Embraer 195-E2 aircraft in preparation for deployment into service.
translation.pcm: Air Peace don beging test flight for dem two new Embraer 195-E2 aircraft as dem dey take prepare to begin use dem.

translation.en: Daily Trust reports that the two aircraft were the first set of the 13 brand new 195-E2 aircraft acquired by the airline to deepen its route expansion.
translation.pcm: Daily Trust be report say di two aircraft na di first set among the 13 brand new 195-E2 aircraft wey di airline buy to helep dem route expansion.

translation.en: A spokesperson for the airline, Stanley Olisa, told newsmen on Friday that one of the aircraft was flown empty from Lagos to Owerri, Abuja, and Port Harcourt for familiarisation on Thursday.
translation.pcm: One toktok pesin for di airline, Stanley Olisa, tell news pipo on Friday say dem fly one di aircrafts empty from Lagos enter Owerri, Abuja and Port Harcourt make e for dey familiar on Thursday.

translation.en: Olisa hinted that test flights to other destinations would continue, adding that in no time, the planes would commence scheduled flights, offering a superior travel experience to customers.
translation.pcm: Olisa give hint say test flight to other destination go continue, and e add that e no go take long di planes dem go start schedule flight and dem go offer better travel experience to dem customers.

translation.en: He disclosed that
translation.pcm: He tok say

translation.en: the third brand new E195-E2 aircraft would be coming in very soon,  stating that the airline's fleet expansion is driven by the commitment to satisfy the air travel needs of Nigerians.
translation.pcm: Di brand new E195-E2 aircraft wey be di third go enter veri soon, dem tok say di reason why dem dey expand dem fleet ni di commitment to take satisfy di air travel need of Naija pipo.

translation.en: The operation of test flights by newly acquired aircraft is a regulatory requirement that must be met before the aircraft is deployed for regular scheduled operations.
translation.pcm: As dem dey take do test flight na regulatory requirement wey dem must to dob before dem carry di aircraft put for regular operation.

translation.en: It would be recalled that Air Peace took delivery of the two brand new ultramodern 124 seat capacity Embraer 195-E2 aircraft in January and March this year, with 11 more slated for delivery.
translation.pcm: We go fit remember say Air Peace kollekt di two brand new ultramordern Embraer 195-E2 aircraft wey get 124 sits for January and March dis year, as dem go kollkt 11 more.

translation.en: Tela Maize harvest shows potential for 8 tons per hectare
translation.pcm: Tela Maize harvest get potential to give 8 tons for inside one hectare

translation.en: Last Tuesday, the Institute for Agricultural Research (IAR), Ahmadu Bello University Zaria, invited relevant stakeholders, including journalists, to witness third harvest of the Tela Maize variety Confined Field Trials (CFT) under its Tela Maize Research Project funded by the Africa Agricultural Technology Foundation (AATF).
translation.pcm: For di Tuesday wey just pass, di Institute for Agricultural Research (IAR), for Ahmadu Bello University Zaria, be invite relevant stakeholders, plus journalist, to kom witness di third harvest of di Tela Maize Variety Confined Field Trials (CFT) under im Tela Maize Research Project wey di  Africa Agricultural Technology Foundation (AATF) dey fund.

translation.en: The maize variety derived its name TELA from the Latin word TUTELA which means protection.
translation.pcm: Dem derive di name for di maize variety TELA for Latin TUTELA wey mean protection.

translation.en: The maize variety is bred with protection against insect pests and draught.
translation.pcm: Dis kind maize na im get protection against pest and draught for im breed.

translation.en: The Principal Investigator, Professor Rabiu Adamu and other scientists who conducted journalists round the harvest, said the idea of the research work was to produce maize varieties that are resistance or that are highly protected against two major insect pests: stalk (stem) borers and Fall Army Worm and additional protection against moderate draught.
translation.pcm: Professor Rabiu Adamu wey be Principal Investigator, plus oda scientist wey carry journalists round d harvest, tok say di idea of di project na to produce maize variety wey dey resistance or wey dey protected against two major insect pest: stalk (stem) borers and Fall Army Worm plus another protection against moderate draught.

translation.en: This is all about producing crops that are high yielding under stressed conditions; the stresses are Fall Army Warm and stem borers, which are major constraints to maize production.
translation.pcm: Dis is all about producing crops that are high yielding under stressed conditions; di stresses are Fall Army Warm and stem borers, which are major constraints to maize production. Na to dey produce crop wey dey yield welwel under hard condition wey dey do; di stresses dem be Fall Army Warm and stem borers, wey be major block to maize production.

translation.en: If not controlled, it could cause up to 80 percent yield lost; and draught  if you don't manage moisture (rain) deficit very well, you may not get any yield.
translation.pcm: If dem no control am, if fit cause loss wey reach 80 percent, plus drought if you no manage rain shortage welwel, you fit no get any yield.

translation.en: We have done this trial for the third time.
translation.pcm: Na di third time be dis wey don do dis trial,

translation.en: We did the first trial under the dry season in March, and during the rainy season, we conducted another one from June to November.
translation.pcm: Na for under dry season for march we do di first trial, and durin di rainy season, we do anoda one from june go enter November.

translation.en: This is the third trial from November to April.
translation.pcm: Na di third trial be dis from November go enter April.

translation.en: So, in essence, this is what we are trying to showcase,the Principal researcher said.
